Guidelines: character, ACMG only right now, for the reporting of incidental variation in a Gene enumerates whether the guideline is from 2013 (ACMG2013, PubMed 23788249) or 2016 (ACMG2016, PubMed 27854360)(NOTE: if ACMG, not a specific to the AlleleID but to the Gene in which the AlleleID is found)
PhenotypeList: character, list of names corresponding to PhenotypeIDs
LastEvaluated: datetime, the latest time any submitter reported clinical significance
HGNC_ID: string, of format HGNC:integer, reported if there is a single GeneID. Otherwise reported as '-'
Start: integer, starting location, in pter->qter orientation
ClinSigSimple: integer,0 = no current value of Likely pathogenic/Pathogenic////1 = at least one current submissions interpreting as Likely pathogenic/
Type: character, the type of variant represented by the AlleleID
NumberSubmitters: integer, number of submitters describing this variant
dbVar_link: The url of the variant in dbVar
Assembly: character, name of the assembly on which locations are based
RS_link: The url of the variant in dbSNP
Stop: integer, end location, in pter->qter orientation
AlleleID: integer value as stored in the AlleleID field in ClinVar
ClinicalSignificance: character, comma-separated list of values of clinical significance reported for this variant for the mapping between the terms listed here and the integers in the .VCF files, see https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/docs/clinsig/ If the value is '-', this allele was submitted to ClinVar as part of a complex variant, and its specific significance has not been submitted to ClinVar.
GeneSymbol: character, comma-separated list of GeneIDs overlapping the variant
ReferenceAllele: The allele at the location defined by start and stop on the reference sequence
Name: character, the preferred name for the record with this AlleleID
OtherIDs: character, list of other identifiers or sources of information about this variant
ChromosomeAccession: Accession and version of the RefSeq sequence defining the position reported in the start and stop columns. Please note some of these accessions may be for sub-chromosomal regions.
AlternateAllele: The difference relative to that reference
Origin: character, list of all allelic origins for this variant
TestedInGTR: character, Y/N for Yes/No if there is a test registered as specific to this variant in the NIH Genetic Testing Registry (GTR)
ReviewStatus: character, highest review status for reporting this measure. For the key to the terms,and their relationship to the star graphics ClinVar displays on its web pages,see http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/docs/variation_report/#interpretation
PhenotypeIDS: character, list of identifiers for phenotype(s) interpreted for this variant
RCVaccession: character, list of RCV accessions that report this variant
nsv/esv (dbVar): character, the NSV identifier for the region in dbVar
OriginSimple: character, processed from Origin to make it easier to distinguish between germline and somatic
GeneID: integer, GeneID in NCBI's Gene database, reported if there is a single gene, otherwise reported as -1.
SubmitterCategories: coded value to indicate whether data were submitted by another resource (1), any other type of source (2) or both (3)
_db_description: ClinVar aggregates information about genomic variation and its relationship to human health.
